name: Cox's Bazar
description: Cox's Bazar is the world's longest natural sea beach, offering scenic views, soft sand, and beautiful sunsets, making it a favorite destination for beach lovers.

name: Sundarbans
description: The Sundarbans is the world's largest mangrove forest and home to the majestic Royal Bengal Tiger, known for its biodiversity and natural beauty.

name: Saint Martin's Island
description: Saint Martin’s Island is a small coral island in the Bay of Bengal, known for its crystal-clear water, coconut trees, and peaceful atmosphere.

name: Sajek Valley
description: Sajek Valley, located in the Chittagong Hill Tracts, is famous for its scenic beauty, cloud-covered hills, and breathtaking sunsets and sunrises.

name: Srimangal
description: Srimangal is known as the tea capital of Bangladesh, with endless tea gardens, rolling green hills, and the unique seven-layer tea.

name: Jaflong
description: Jaflong, located in Sylhet, offers stunning views of hills, rivers, and stone collection activities. It’s famous for natural beauty and tribal culture.

name: Rangamati
description: Rangamati is a beautiful hill district featuring the serene Kaptai Lake, tribal culture, hanging bridges, and tranquil natural surroundings.

name: Kuakata
description: Kuakata is known as the 'Daughter of the Sea' and offers the unique view of both sunrise and sunset over the Bay of Bengal.

name: Mahasthangarh
description: Mahasthangarh is an ancient archaeological site in Bogura, showcasing the remains of a lost city from the 3rd century BC.

name: Lalbagh Fort
description: Lalbagh Fort is an unfinished Mughal fortress in Dhaka, reflecting rich history, Mughal architecture, and a peaceful garden setting.
